h1.span: Coronavirus/COVID-19 Information as it relates to WNSC

p.img: The West Noble staff will be parading through our community at 2 pm on Tuesday, April 21. Watch for the sirens and the West Noble bus!

span.p: Parade Order... Kimmell, Cromwell, Ligonier, Wawaka. WN STAFF PARADE ROUTE
See you soon!

WNSC Continuous Learning Plan / Remote Learning (COVID-19) - West Noble School Corporation will deliver high-quality continuous learning opportunities for all students through eLearning. Learning opportunities will be delivered through digital platforms such as Google Classroom, YouTube, Google Meets, Remind, and Class Do Jo. Paper packets will be created and distributed to students for additional enrichment, supplemental class materials, or distance learning if digital learning is not an option for a child's family. Read more.
April 03, 2020 - Superintendent Mast

Good afternoon West Noble. We have received new guidance from the Governor's Office and from the Indiana Department of Education. Face to face instruction in all Indiana Schools has been canceled for the 19-20 school year. However, the DOE is asking us to be sure to conduct at least 160 school days, which means that we at WN will be having 19 E-Learning Dates, starting the Monday after Spring Break. We have completed 141 school days thus far for the 19-20 school year.

E-Learning Days will be Monday, Wednesday, and Friday each week. Assignments for the week will be given on Mondays and are due on Friday of that same week. Teacher office hours are 9-11 and 1-3 daily on Mon, Wed, Fri. The week of May 18-22 is the final week of school. There will be 4 E-Learning days that week (Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri). The first day of E-Learning is April 13. Our final day is May 22.
Food service will not be handing out meals next week during spring break. That service will resume on the 15th of April. More information will be coming.

ul.li: April 20-24, 2020 - eLearning Summary
April 13-17, 2020 - eLearning Summary

April 8, 2020 - Spring Break Challenge - Post a picture of what you/your family are doing with this unique Spring Break. #Chargers
https://www.facebook.com/WestNobleHighSchool/videos/631333304091490/?t=111

April 20, 2020 - Welcome to Week 2 of our continuous learning plan! We are proud of our Charger Families for your hard work last week; we had 96% attendance in Week 1! Keep up the good work! Assignments for Week 2 are posted today, and our teachers are ready to assist you on Mon, Wed and Fri from 9-11 AM and 1-3 PM. Students should complete this week's attendance link provided in Classroom.
The West Noble Staff will be parading through the community to wave at students on Tuesday, April 21 beginning at 2 PM. We will pass through Kimmell, Cromwell, Ligonier and Wawaka. Watch for us!

April 13, 2020 - Good Morning Chargers! Today is week one of our continuous learning plan. This week's lessons and attendance form are posted in Google Classroom accounts today. Staff are available to help you from 9-11 AM and 1-3 PM Mon, Wed and Fri this week. If you wish to call the school and leave a message, please use (260) 894-3191 ex. 2001 or ex. 2055. We will check messages frequently. We miss you! Let's keep moving forward together!

April 12, 2020 - WNP parents - If your student receives speech or language services please check your student's emails for a request from Mrs. Cabello to join her Google classroom. This email will not go to students who are in Early Intervention or Applied Skills.

April 1, 2020 - Charger Gear Friday, April 3.
Our West Noble community is strong and compassionate. Right now, some of our finest people are battling illness. We want to surround these people and their families with prayer, love, and support. West Noble School Corporation is encouraging all community members to wear Charger Gear this Friday, April 3 to stand behind those who are currently fighting sickness. Please take a picture in your Charger attire (Red & Blue) and post it on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter). You also may choose to hold a ¨Get Well" sign. Please include the hashtag #ChargerStrong so everyone can search for these photos. We are blessed to be in such a strong community!

March 30, 2020 - Memo via Remind, Superintendent Mast
The Food Service delivery to students for this Wednesday (April 1) has been canceled. We do not have any new updates from the Governor’s Office or from the Indiana Department of Education at this time, therefore, our expected return date to school is still May 1.

March 27, 2020 - Memo via Remind, Superintendent Mast
The county health director notified us today that there is a confirmed case of Coronavirus at West Noble. The person specified works in the corporation office. Please keep this person and their family in your prayers.
March 13, 2020 - Letter from Superintendent Mast
March 9, 2020 - Letter from Superintendent Mast

p.span: April 7, 2020 - How to Handle Chromebook Repairs

span.p: In this time of online continuous learning, your West Noble Technology Office would like to address chromebook repairs for all students, grades 2-12. Students, parents/guardians, teachers, or administrators can use this West Noble Chromebook Repair form to report chromebook problems. Because many issues can be resolved remotely, a technician will contact the student or parent/guardian directly with help. If a chromebook or charger is broken, we will schedule a device swap.
April 7, 2020 - All of our school parking lots can be used as hotspots. If close enough to the building, the signal should be available.
March 25, 2020 - Additional hotspots
LigtTel Communications has added more Wi-Fi Hotspots for students to use for E-Learning and schoolwork. Please see the attached document for additional information concerning the hotspots.
The new Wi-Fi Hotspot locations are

Wolf Lake Grain & Farm Supply
1644 State Road 109, Albion, IN 46701
North side of the main building (back towards Wolf Lake). Open parking lot area.

Half Acre Cafe
23 State Road 9, Albion, IN 46701
Southwest part of the parking lot. Next to the big telephone pole.
March 20, 2020

A huge thank you to LigTel Communications. As of today, they have installed several Wi-Fi hotspots at various locations in Noble County where families can take their children and have access to internet service allowing them to complete their work.
Please see the attached document for additional information concerning the hotspots. Parents/students may have additional information via communications with teachers/principals.
April 3, 2020
Food service will not be handing out meals next week during spring break. That service will resume on the 15th of April. More information will be coming.
March 30, 2020
Food Service delivery to students for this Wednesday, April 1, has been canceled.
March 17, 2020

div.p: All WN students, age 0 through grade 12, are eligible to receive free meals while WN Schools are closed due to the Coronavirus/COVID-19. This program starts Wednesday, March 25 and runs each Wednesday through April 22 including Spring Break. It will be a drive-through with staff handing out the bags.

Each bag will contain 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches. Parents should check the bags as some products will need to be refrigerated. Also, if your child has a peanut allergy, check the bag before serving your student.

ul.li: Dates: Wednesdays - March 25, April 1, 8, 15, 22

Times and Locations – You may pick up meals at either site, not both. Children need to be present.
11:00 am – 1:00 pm – West Noble Primary / Front Drive
5:oo pm – 7:00 pm – West Noble High School / Front Staff Parking Lot

h2.strong: Weekend Food Bags - Begins Saturday, April 4

span.p: March 27, 2020

Charger PowerPaks (weekend food bags) will be distributed every Saturday throughout the remainder of the shutdown period beginning April 4. PowerPaks will be available to any West Noble student in need of weekend food. Food can be picked up at three sites: WN Primary from 10-11:00 am, Eagle's Nest from 11:15 am - 12:00 pm and Stone Ridge Estates from 12:15-1:00 pm. A truck will be parked at the parking lot of WNP, the main building at the front of Eagle's Nest and the old Marathon parking lot of Stone Ridge Estates. PowerPaks are distributed through New Community Initiatives, not West Noble Schools, and will be given on a first come first serve basis.

ul.li: March 30, 2020 - Food Service delivery to WN students has been canceled for April 1.
March 17 - Final practice for all spring sports and events until further notice
March 16, 2020 - WN Middle School - All athletic events and practices canceled until further notice.

March 12, 2020 - The JR NECC Athletics - (RE: 2020 JR NECC Wrestling & JR NECC Girls Basketball Tournaments) The Jr. NECC recognizes the fluidity of COVID-19 and its impact on hosting events in a public space. COVID-19 is spreading rapidly in the United States, and behavioral risk mitigation strategies are the best for slowing the spread of this disease. Due to an abundance of caution during this National Health Emergency involving the COVID-19 virus, the Jr. NECC is indefinitely postponing the 2020 Jr NECC Girls Basketball Tournament, as well as the 2020 Jr. NECC Wrestling Tournament. The decision on when, or if the tournament will resume, will be made by the administration of all conference schools. We will move forward and work in a consistent manner with current information, and we will continue to monitor and make adjustments as needed.
